Gold holds post-spike risk premium as Trump backs off tariffs and Goldman lifts target to $5,400

$XAU is catching its breath above 4,800 dollars after a sharp move higher. Some of the â€œrisk premiumâ€ from tariff fears is easing, but bank targets, ETF flows, and miner strength still point to a firmly bullish backdrop.

Market trends
â€¢ Political stress cools, but not gone: the Greenlandâ€“tariff saga that powered the latest leg higher is now partly unwinding. Headlines that President Trump is stepping back from tariff threats eased the most extreme demand for defensive assets and triggered a modest pullback from record levels. The risk mood improved, but the geopolitical and trade backdrop is far from calm.
â€¢ Goldman turns more bullish: Goldman Sachs raised its gold target to 5,400 dollars by December 2026 (from 4,900). Thatâ€™s a clear signal that, even with tactical pullbacks, the street still sees this as a structural bull market with higher long-term â€œceilingâ€ levels.
â€¢ Dollar as headwind: the dollar is pushing higher. SWIFT data show USDâ€™s share in global payments rose to 50.5% in December (from 46.8%), the highest since 2023 under the new methodology. A stronger dollar usually caps upside for gold and helps explain why price has paused after the latest surge.
â€¢ ETF/ETC flows still roaring: despite record prices, issuance of physically backed products keeps growing:
â€“ Xtrackers IE Physical Gold EUR Hedged ETC: extra 74,000 units around â‚¬59.78 each; total series now 21,630,991 units, each backed by 0.0144 oz.
â€“ iShares Physical Gold ETC: fresh 3,119,000 units issued, pushing the series to 411,004,777 units.
Big money is not dumping into strength, but quietly adding exposure into this high-price regime.

Techs
Support: 4,750â€“4,800 dollars (recent breakout and consolidation zone)
Resistance: 4,950â€“5,000 dollars (round-number magnet if momentum resumes)

Equities
Equity markets are breathing a bit easier as tariff fears fade, which trims emergency demand for defensive assets but supports overall risk appetite. Within that context, gold miners and streaming names remain standout winners.
â€¢ Rotation into leveraged gold plays:
â€“ Barrick Mining recently hit a 52-week high around 50.54 dollars.
â€“ Wheaton Precious Metals printed a new all-time high near 145.52 dollars.
â€“ Kinross Gold tagged a record around 37.46 dollars, with mentions of overbought RSI in market commentary.
Capital is clearly reaching for â€œgold beta,â€ not just the metal itself.
â€¢ Operations backing the move:
â€“ Resolute Mining: Q4 production of 65,918 oz, with 2026 guidance at 250â€“275k oz and AISC at 2,000â€“2,200 dollars.
â€“ Aris Mining: full-year 2025 output of 256,503 oz, up 22% year-on-year and above the midpoint of guidance.
Strong operational delivery gives investors more confidence that the current price regime can translate into real cash flow.

RWA & tokenization
In parallel, the real-world-asset stack keeps deepening, building more rails that can intersect with gold and other hard assets.
â€¢ On-chain scale: within the Solana ecosystem alone, RWA market cap has now tagged 1 billion dollars, excluding stablecoins.
â€¢ Macro TVL shift: RWAs have overtaken DEXs in total value locked, with around 21.4 billion dollars now sitting in tokenized Treasuries, private credit, and commodities.
â€¢ Legacy giants leaning in:
â€“ BlackRock CEO Larry Fink calls â€œtokenization of financial assets and AIâ€ the two megatrends that will reshape financial services.
â€“ The New York Stock Exchange is building a platform for 24/7 trading and instant settlement of tokenized securities.
These are structural signals that the infrastructure for putting real assets, including metals, on programmable rails is moving from pitch deck to implementation.

Crypto vs Gold
In this phase, the â€œdigital goldâ€ story looks weaker when you compare actual price behavior.
â€¢ BTC / gold ratio slides: the bitcoin-to-gold ratio has dropped to around 18.5 oz per BTC, highlighting how much more strongly gold has performed as a defensive anchor in this window of uncertainty.
â€¢ Role split:
â€“ Gold is reacting cleanly to geopolitical and trade risks, holding a risk premium even with a stronger dollar.
â€“ Bitcoin is not showing comparable defensive behavior; its crisis-hedge narrative remains contested once you look at real price action rather than marketing.
What to watch
â€¢ Trade rhetoric: any fresh twists or U-turns on the Greenland story can quickly reprice the â€œrisk premiumâ€ baked into gold.
â€¢ Dollar dynamics: further USD strength, backed by its growing role in payments is the main short-term headwind for gold.
â€¢ ETC issuance: continued large-scale issuance and inflows will confirm that institutional demand is still there on any dip.
â€¢ Minersâ€™ price action: whether leaders like Barrick, Wheaton, and Kinross can hold near record levels will say a lot about how broad and durable the trend is.

Takeaways
â€¢ Gold: the market is shifting from a vertical spike to a tactical pause as tariff fears cool. But Goldmanâ€™s 5,400-dollar target for December 2026 and ongoing ETC issuance underline a structurally bullish backdrop. Baseline: high prices with the risk of sharp but brief pullbacks when headlines calm down. Strategy: hold core exposure; add only on clear dips and only while macro and political risk remain elevated.
â€¢ Miners: the sector shows exceptional strength with a cluster of all-time and 52-week highs, but local overheating is likely. Focus on leaders with solid guidance and real operating momentum; be careful with names that have run hard without matching fundamentals.
â€¢ Crypto: stance stays neutral-to-negative on the â€œdefensiveâ€ axis. The current configuration of risks and returns still favors classic metal over coin, and the BTC/gold ratio reflects that shift.

Not financial advice. Always do your own research.

Revolution from Toly: Will New Token Rules Save Retail Traders?  Hey bro! Solana's co-founder, Toly, just dropped a manifesto that hits right at the core problem. We're all tired of schemes where we, the retail traders, always end up losing. He's proposing a clear formula to change that.  The essence of his plan is simple:  1. Staking is the foundation. Long-term holders are rewarded, not speculators.  2. >20% of tokens in circulation from day one. No more 2% liquidity with billions in FDV.  3. Investors (if absolutely necessary) get a 100% unlock only after one year. No lengthy vesting schedules.  4. The team also waits.  Why is this a game-changer for us traders?  Because the current model is a trap. Funds get in early for pennies. A tiny fraction of tokens hits the public market with a sky-high valuation (FDV). We see the hype and buy in. Then, 6-12 months later, insider unlocks start, and the price crashes under a ton of selling pressure. We're just being used for exit liquidity.  Toly's model breaks this scheme. If there's a large circulating supply from day one, the price is set by the real market. If investors can only exit after a year and all at once, the team is motivated to build, not just wait for their unlock. The risk of a post-TGE crash plummets.  What happens if this gets adopted?  - Fewer "scams": Fewer projects created just for VC unlocks.  - Fair price discovery: Market cap will be closer to reality, not inflated FDV.  - Community power: Projects with strong staking communities will have an advantage.  This is a challenge to the entire funding industry. And Solana, as the most hype-driven L1, might just be the one to push it through.  Question: Do you think any major project will dare to launch by Toly's rules, or will they all fear the wrath of the venture funds?  $SOL  #SOL  #Solana  #Crypto  #CryptoNews  #Web3

$DONT is a meme token created on the Solana blockchain by DeFi Development Corp., a U.S. company whose shares trade publicly like $APPLE or $TESLA.

This matters because companies like this normally donâ€™t create meme coins at all.

The company said very clearly that this token:
has no product behind it
has no plan or roadmap
has no promised use
and people were even told not to buy it

So why create it?

This was done as an experiment.

The company wanted to see what would happen if a token existed openly on chain, with no attention, no promises, and full transparency.

From the start, the token supply was clearly explained:

-40% was made available for the public to trade
-30% was kept by the company and said to be held long-term
-20% was set aside for community and ecosystem uses
-10% went to early contributors

No extra tokens can suddenly appear. Nothing is hidden.

After launch, people still traded it.

Prices moved. Volatility happened.

Thatâ€™s normal when attention and trading activity meet limited supply.

The key point is not the price.

The key point is this:

A traditional public company just tested how crypto markets behave when a token exists only as an open, transparent experiment.

This isnâ€™t really about $DONT.

Itâ€™s about how companies may start using blockchains in new and unexpected ways.

$ALL  update - TEE Technology ğŸ   We just shipped a major app update that completes our entire #TEE  technology stack. The core implementation is finished, and we are now focused on deep integration and reorganizing the application for seamless, production ready performance. The first TEE powered services are expected to launch in February on the Sallar network as a powerful new utility layer for enterprises and individual users alike.   TEEs solve a core modern challenge: processing sensitive data safely on systems you do not fully control, especially in the cloud. They originated in the early 2000s with ARM TrustZone for mobile devices and later expanded through major industry efforts such as Intel SGX and AMD SEV. Their main purpose is confidential computing: protecting data during active processing even when the host OS or cloud provider might be untrusted.   For everyday phone users, TEE is quietly responsible for security features we rely on daily. Contactless payments are designed so payment credentials and signing operations are handled inside secure, hardware backed components, reducing exposure even if the main OS is compromised. Biometric templates are typically stored and matched inside secure environments, so apps and the broader system do not receive raw biometric data. Password manager keys, secure boot checks that help detect device tampering, and protected media playback commonly depend on TEE style isolation to keep sensitive operations separated and harder to extract.   For Sallar users, this means businesses can run confidential workflows with provable, tamper resistant execution, while individuals get significantly safer personal data handling in practical tools. In February, we expect to deliver the first live TEE utilities, and we will expand the feature set step by step afterward.   Sallar is a #DePIN  on $SOL  blockchain.
